My quick summary:
The adaption of the 1986 4 issue mini series, which has been collected as a graphic novel form. This is the story that changed batman in the world, for better or worse. This TRULY re-grounded him after years of being a space adventure who wore technicolor suits to fit the day of the week. Bruce retired after the death of the Second Robin, Jason Todd(the one not brought into any animated SERIES to date, due to the death of his character being a large part of why the third robin was brought in).The graphic novel depicts a lot of elements Nolan would use in Dark Knight Rises, such as an intercity war between the gangs and the people of Gotham, and a pair of fights between Bruce and a bad guy that first Bruce badly loses, then the second time around wins in a vicious beat down. 

While it is animated, this movie is probably dark and realistic batman tale ever written made into movie form.

A few elements you need to know about before watching this with your child: there are very violent acts of murder either shown or talked about(including a few nuns and childern), one case of an off screen suicide, and sexual slang tossed toward a 13 year old ("Chicken legs" when the mutants talk to Carrie). Batman fallout even kills a few people.
